etymology.description: 美 ‘beauty’ + 术 ‘technique; skill’ = fine arts (arts of beauty, esp. visual).
etymology.interpretation: Combines the notion of beauty with technique to denote art forms focused on visual aesthetics such as painting, sculpture, and design. Often contrasted with 艺术/藝術 (art in general) as a narrower, visual-arts sense.
etymology.simplification: 术 is the simplified form of 術, created to reduce strokes and standardize writing; 美 is unchanged. Meaning remains the same.

examples.chinese: 我在大学学美术(我在大學學美術)。
examples.english: I study fine arts in college.

examples.chinese: 她的美术作品很有创意(她的美術作品很有創意)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de měishù zuòpǐn hěn yǒu chuàngyì.
examples.english: Her art pieces are very creative.

examples.chinese: 学校有美术课(學校有美術課)，也有音乐课(也有音樂課)。
examples.pinyin: Xuéxiào yǒu měishù kè, yě yǒu yīnyuè kè.
examples.english: The school has art classes and also music classes.
